commentText: Wheatley repeatedly attacks her own culture: her place of origin is a "Pagan" land, she calls her soul "benighted", and calls her race "black as Cain." If viewed Wheatley is being as sarcastic as possible, she is being excessively appeasing to the dominant Puritan majority to the point of being exhausting. Wheatley is in essence mocking the degree to which her race has been subjugated.
